column1: Everything outside of  the <CASE_DATA> or <COMPONENT_DATA>  flag is for notes, etc.
Note that demand has no decisions.
Note that unmet demand is represented a source with a variable cost only, so unmet demand has an output decision.
Information about PyPSA components and their attributes can be found here: https://pypsa.readthedocs.io/en/latest/components.html

column2: Name of bus from which this technology would get or give its energy (or in the case of link, the giving bus)
Name of time series file that will get loaded
Fixed cost, if not defined default is 0
Marginal cost, if not defined default is 0
Hours at max capacity for StorageUnit
Assume cyclic state of charge for StorageUnit (Boolean)
Losses per hour to state of charge

column4: Note: Dates must be formatted as text (not excel date format)

column3: Note: this assumes time unit for dt is 'hour'

column4: Note: Can be error, warning, info, or debug and specifies level of detail in terminal output
Note: Factor to avoid rounding in Gurobi solver for small values

column6: Note: p_min_pu allow bidirectionality of link

column9: Note: Capital costs are the product of hourly fixed costs and time_range

column4: Note: For Link, bus is interpreted as bus0
column8: Note: p_nom is a factor multiplied to the given capacity
column15: Note: For StorageUnit, efficiency is interpreted as efficiency_store

column18: Note: PyPSA costs storage_unit by power cost; cost of energy capacity is effectively capital_cost/max_hours

column1: Note that any information that is in a column without an attribute header is consider a comment, and not used.
Note that for MEM, storage is in energy units whereas for PyPSA it is in power units.
Note that H46-H52  contain formulas, and our PyPSA front end will read this in as a value.
Note: If there is a # in front of component (e.g. #Generator), this row will be ignored

column2: Note: This is a test case, the costs aren't meant to be very realistic but provide reproducibility in tests
